definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony

sentences.english: This changes when Mr Kaletsky analyses the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 卡里茲基對金融危機的分析卻有所不同。

sentences.english: Ms Fernández used the world financial crisis as an excuse for bringing forward the election.
sentences.chinese: 法娜赫姿女士利用世界金融危機作爲藉口參加競選。

sentences.english: To a degree, the financial crisis is respon­sible.
sentences.chinese: 從某種程度來說，金融危機正是誘因所在。

sentences.english: Bank recapitalization is a key element in the World Bank Group’s response to the global financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 充資是世行集團應對全球金融危機的一項主要舉措。

sentences.english: Korea plutocrat is the prime cause that causes financial crisis to erupt.
sentences.chinese: 韓國財閥是導致金融危機爆發的根本原因。

sentences.english: Ah, what a difference a homegrown financial crisis makes.
sentences.chinese: 啊，一場國產的金融危機令一切大變樣。

sentences.english: This financial crisis has reinforced my view.
sentences.chinese: 金融危機加強了我的這一觀點。

sentences.english: The government predicates that the market collapse was caused by Asian financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府宣佈市場不景氣是由於亞洲金融危機而引起的。

sentences.english: The ROK will work with China to cope with the international financial crisis, he said.
sentences.chinese: 韓方將同中方共同努力，應對國際金融危機。

sentences.english: These countries have been seriously disadvantaged by the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 這些國家由於金融危機而受到嚴重損失。

sentences.english: That appetite has remained following the GFC.
sentences.chinese: 這種偏好一直持續到全球金融危機。

sentences.english: The financial crisis was horribly damaging. But slowly but surely we are building up a head of steam.
sentences.chinese: 雖然金融危機造成的損失巨大，但我們正在蓄勢待發。

sentences.english: This is the beginning of economic crisis. But do not worry.
sentences.chinese: 今年才識金融危機的開始，不過不用擔心。

sentences.english: Emboldened by the current global financial crisis, anti-free-market critics have grown increasingly boisterous.
sentences.chinese: 當前的全球金融危機讓反對自由市場的調門越來越高。

sentences.english: The world financial crisis accentuated comparisons between the economies, drawing attention to Moscow’s policies.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯注意到世界金融危機加重了各國經濟的對比。

sentences.english: Bush's own ideological inclinations against regulation certainly contributed to the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 布什自己違反常規的空想傾向無疑造成了金融危機。

definition: to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
